Applications for citizenship by members or former members of armed forces
	Schedule 1 to the British Nationality Act 1981 (requirements fornaturalisation as a British citizen under section 6(1) of that Act) is amendedin accordance with subsections (2) and (3).
	Paragraph 2 becomes sub-paragraph (1) of that paragraph.
	After that sub-paragraph insert—
	Sub-paragraph (3) applies in a case where, on the date of the application,the applicant is or has been a member of the armed forces.
	If in the special circumstances of the particular case the Secretary ofState thinks fit, he may for the purposes of paragraph 1 treat the applicantas fulfilling the requirement specified in paragraph 1(2)(a) although theapplicant was not in the United Kingdom at the beginning of the period therementioned.”
	In section 39 of the Borders, Citizenship and Immigration Act 2009 (whichcontains further amendments of paragraph 2 of Schedule 1 to the BritishNationality Act 1981)—
		in subsection (4) for the words from the beginning to “paragraph)”substitute “In sub-paragraph (1) of paragraph 2 of that Schedule”;
		in subsection (9) for the words “After that sub-paragraph insert”substitute “For sub-paragraphs (2) and (3) of paragraph 2 substitute”.
Citation, commencement and extent
	This Act may be cited as the Citizenship (Armed Forces) Act 2014.
	This Act comes into force at the end of the period of two months beginningwith the day on which it is passed.
	This Act extends to—
		England and Wales,
		Scotland, 
		Northern Ireland,
		the Channel Islands,
		the Isle of Man, and
		the British overseas territories.
